variants.Description in input context: L166P destabilizes the protein, leading to reduced stability.
M26I is less unstable than L166P but still reduces protein stability.
R98Q is stable and does not significantly affect protein stability.

Material used.Description: Proteasome inhibition was tested using HEK293 cells expressing L166P, M26I, or R98Q variants.

Readout description.Result Description: Proteasome inhibition partially rescued protein levels for L166P.
Proteasome inhibition partially rescued protein levels for M26I.
R98Q showed no significant change in protein levels under proteasome inhibition.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was run in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type cDNA was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein expression greater than 80% under proteasome inhibition.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Protein expression less than 50% under proteasome inhibition.

Material used.Description: Subcellular localization was analyzed using HEK293 cells under oxidative stress conditions.

Readout description.Result Description: L166P showed reduced mitochondrial localization under oxidative stress.
M26I showed reduced mitochondrial localization under oxidative stress.
R98Q maintained normal mitochondrial localization under oxidative stress.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was run in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type cDNA was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Chi-square test was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Normal mitochondrial localization observed in ≥80% of cells.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Reduced mitochondrial localization observed in ≥50% of cells.
